articles.title: Michael Hooper: Australian captain not in right 'mindset' to play for Wallabies
articles.description: Australia captain Michael Hooper withdraws from Saturday's Rugby Championship opener away to Argentina and will return home as he is not in the right "mindset" to play.
articles.content:
Last updated on .From the section Rugby Union
Michael Hooper first captained Australia in 2014

articles.title: Rugby-Australia captain Hooper withdraws from Argentina test, returns home
articles.description: Australia captain Michael Hooper has withdrawn from Saturday’s Rugby Championship clash with Argentina in Mendoza and will return home after informing coach Dave Rennie he was not in the right frame of mind to play.
articles.content: Australia captain Michael Hooper has withdrawn from Saturday’s Rugby Championship clash with Argentina in Mendoza and will return home after informing coach Dave Rennie he was not in the right frame of mind to play. Hooper trained with the team this ... [1209 chars]

articles.title: NEWSMAKER-Argentina's ambitious 'superminister' takes on economic crisis
articles.description: In 2013, Massa founded a new party called the Renewal Front, which eventually joined forces with other Peronist factions to create a center-left group that went on to defeat ex-President Mauricio Macri's coalition in the 2019 election. Over the past decade, Argentina's rough and tumble politics, amplified by the deepening economic crisis, have taken a toll on Massa's popularity.
articles.content:
Asked about Sergio Massa, Argentina's new "superminister" for the economy, many Argentines perceive him as an opportunistic politician with limitless ambition.
But Massa's political acumen, honed over four decades of party-hopping activism, is also w... [3628 chars]

articles.description: Union MoS Ajay Bhatt said the other four countries that have shown interest are Indonesia, Phillipines, Argentina and Egypt
articles.content: The US, Australia, Indonesia and the Philippines are among six countries, which have shown interest in India’s Tejas aircraft while Malaysia has already shortlisted the jet under its acquisition programme, the government said on Friday. The other two... [1716 chars]

articles.title: FACTBOX-Monkeypox cases and deaths around the world
articles.description:
* SPAIN reported its second death on July 30. Below is a list of non-endemic countries that have reported monkeypox cases: ASIA-PACIFIC * AUSTRALIA had confirmed 54 cases as of Aug. 4.
* The UNITED ARAB EMIRATES had reported 16 infections as of July 24. AMERICAS * ARGENTINA had confirmed 32 cases as of Aug. 3. * The BAHAMAS confirmed its first case on June 24.
articles.content: More than 80 countries where monkeypox is not endemic have reported outbreaks of the viral disease, which the World Health Organization has declared a global health emergency, as confirmed cases crossed 26,500 and non-endemic countries reported their... [4399 chars]

articles.title: Jed Holloway, Australia vs Argentina, cut by Waratahs, Michael Cheika, Pablo Matera
articles.description: From ‘shafted’ to climbing all the way back: Holloway finally caps off Wallabies journey
articles.content:
Amongst the litany of positive stories in rugby, few rival Jed Holloway’s long road to the top.
On Sunday (AEST), all the effort will be worth it when the 29-year-old makes his long-awaited debut for the Wallabies.
